anyOf.title: Segment Entry Node
anyOf.description: The first node in a journey - triggered when a user enters a segment.

anyOf.title: Event Entry Node
anyOf.description: The first node in a journey - triggered when a user performs a specific event.

exitNode.title: Exit Node
exitNode.description: Defines when a user exits a journey. Allows users to re-enter the journey, under some set of conditions.

anyOf.title: Delay Node
anyOf.description: Delays a users progression through the journey for either a set amount of time, or until a specific date time.

anyOf.title: Rate Limit Node
anyOf.description: Used to limit the frequency with which users are contacted by a given Journey.

anyOf.title: Segment Split Node
anyOf.description: Used to split users among audiences, based on the behavior and attributes.

anyOf.title: Message Node
anyOf.description: Used to contact a user on a message channel.

anyOf.title: Experiment Split Node
anyOf.description: Used to split users among experiment paths, to test their effectiveness.

anyOf.description: A node which waits for a user to enter a segment before progressing.

post.description: The Identify call lets you tie a user to their actions and record traits about them. It includes a unique User ID and any optional traits you know about the user, like their email, name, and more.

messageId.description: Unique identifier for the message, used as an idempotency key for safe retries. Can provide a UUID.

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 formatted timestamp of when the event occurred. If not provided, the current server time will be used.

context.description: Provides metadata about the user submitting the event and the context in which the event occurred.

traits.description: Free-form dictionary of traits of the user, like email or name. Can contain arbitrary JSON values.

userId.description: Unique identifier for the user. Should be the id of the user in your system. Only applicable to logged in users.

traits.description: Free-form dictionary of traits of the user, like email or name. Can contain arbitrary JSON values.

anonymousId.description: Identifier for a logged out user. It can be any pseudo-unique identifier, for example a session Id or a UUID.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: Authorization header for the request, in the format `Bearer <token>`. Find your token at https://app.dittofeed.com/dashboard/settings#write-key.

post.description: The Track call is how you record any actions your users perform, along with any properties that describe the action.

properties.description: Free-form dictionary of properties of the event, like revenue or product name. Can contain arbitrary JSON values.

anyOf.description: The first node in a journey - triggered when a user performs a specific event.

exitNode.title: Exit Node
exitNode.description: Defines when a user exits a journey. Allows users to re-enter the journey, under some set of conditions.

anyOf.title: Delay Node
anyOf.description: Delays a users progression through the journey for either a set amount of time, or until a specific date time.

anyOf.title: Rate Limit Node
anyOf.description: Used to limit the frequency with which users are contacted by a given Journey.

anyOf.title: Segment Split Node
anyOf.description: Used to split users among audiences, based on the behavior and attributes.

anyOf.title: Message Node
anyOf.description: Used to contact a user on a message channel.

anyOf.title: Experiment Split Node
anyOf.description: Used to split users among experiment paths, to test their effectiveness.

anyOf.title: Wait For Node
anyOf.description: A node which waits for a user to enter a segment before progressing.
